hedline.hl1: New Agency Posts For the Americas

abstract.p: FCB Worldwide in New York, part of True North Communications, names Mike Bosman president and chief operating officer at FCB North America; Bates Worldwide, part of Cordiant Communications Group, names Gary McBride president at Bates Latin America (S)

block.p: Two agencies are creating posts to oversee operations in North America and Latin America.

At FCB Worldwide in New York, part of True North Communications, Mike Bosman is being named president and chief operating officer at FCB North America, effective on Aug. 1. Mr. Bosman, 40, had been chairman and chief executive for the South African and African operations of FCB, based in Cape Town, and will move to New York. He joined FCB in 1997, when his agency, Bosman Johnson in Cape Town, was acquired by FCB.
Two agencies are creating posts to oversee operations in North America and Latin America.

At FCB Worldwide in New York, part of True North Communications, Mike Bosman is being named president and chief operating officer at FCB North America, effective on Aug. 1. Mr. Bosman, 40, had been chairman and chief executive for the South African and African operations of FCB, based in Cape Town, and will move to New York. He joined FCB in 1997, when his agency, Bosman Johnson in Cape Town, was acquired by FCB.

And at Bates Worldwide in New York, part of the Cordiant Communications Group, Gary McBride is being named president at Bates Latin America, to be based in Miami. Mr. McBride, 45, will oversee operations in the Caribbean, Mexico and Central and South America as well as the Miami office of the Bates USA unit of Bates Worldwide, which specializes in advertising to Spanish-speaking consumers. Mr. McBride joins Bates Latin America from GEMS International Television in Miramar, Fla., where he had been president and chief executive.
